intro: Thesium macrocarpum, commonly known as the large-fruited thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish flowers, which are typically pollinated by insects. Its fruits are follicles that contain several seeds, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Thesium macrocarpum is native to parts of Africa and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
